title: On the Information Capacity of Nearest Neighbor Representations. (arXiv:2305.05808v1 [cs.CC])
abstract: The $\textit{von Neumann Computer Architecture}$ has a distinction between computation and memory. In contrast, the brain has an integrated architecture where computation and memory are indistinguishable.
